segments.text: I see the water just pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a little waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's actually kind of beautiful, the way the light catches the water as it falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle on the floor is getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so calm, just drying her dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be in her own little world, completely unaware of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so inviting, with its neat path and low bushes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she planted all those flowers herself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy climbing on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it's a treasure chest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His determination is kind of cute, even if it's a bit risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they all realize what's happening soon, before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is a mix of chaos and calm, and it's strangely captivating.
segments.speaker: PAR
